Bhutan: In a succession dispute in Cooch Behar, the Druk Desi's nominee for the throne was opposed by a rival who invited British troops; in effect, Cooch Behar became a dependency of the British East India Company.
British expeditionary forces drive Bhutanese garrisons out of Cooch Behar, until that time a Bhutanese dependency. The Druk Desi petitions Lhasa unsuccessfully for assistance. (to 1773)
Brazil: The Kingdom of Portugal divides its colony of the State of Great-Pará and Maranhão into the State of Great-Pará (capital, Belém) and the State of Maranhão (capital, São Luis).
Colombia: Manuel de Guirior is Viceroy of New Granada
Russia: The first partition of Poland was announced. Poland lost thirty percent of its territory, which was divided between Prussia, Austria, and Russia.
Sweden: Absolute monarchy is reintroduced in Sweden through the Revolution of 1772.
USA: The Watauga Association, in modern-day Tennessee, declared itself independent.
Gaspee Affair: The British schooner Gaspee was burned.
Samuel Adams organized the Committees of Correspondence.
